name: transience
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being transient (= temporary): the transience of human existence/fame Her paintings are metaphors for the transience and fragility of life.
mainly US the fact of living only temporarily in a place: In many American cities, transience in one's 20s and 30s is an accepted part of modern life. The city appeals to gangs because of the transience of the population. See
transient
More examplesFewer examplesThese people highlight the transience of fame and the lengths some will go to in achieving it. Such events make us think about our transience and death.The New Yorker has led a life of transience and loss.
